detailedSolution:
We have the sum of interior angles is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>360</mn>
      <mo>∘<!-- ∘ --></mo>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{360^ \circ }</annotation></semantics></math>. Then, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>x</mi>
  <mo>=</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>9.</mn>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">x =  - 9.</annotation></semantics></math> The other angles measure <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>54</mn>
      <mo>∘<!-- ∘ --></mo>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{54^ \circ }</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>111</mn>
      <mo>∘<!-- ∘ --></mo>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{111^ \circ }</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mrow class="MJX-TeXAtom-ORD">
    <msup>
      <mn>44</mn>
      <mo>∘<!-- ∘ --></mo>
    </msup>
  </mrow>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">{44^ \circ }</annotation></semantics></math>.
